snippet: China’s central bank said it wanted to assess the risks that customers could face using the untested services from the online giants Alibaba and Tencent.
abstract: China's central bank orders Internet giants Alibaba and Tencent to halt plans to issue virtual credit cards in partnership with large Chinese bank China Citic Bank International, citing concerns over safety risks.

byline.contributor: Shanshan Wang contributed research from Beijing.

lead_paragraph: China’s central bank said it wanted to assess the risks that customers could face using the untested services from the online giants Alibaba and Tencent.

headline.main: China Puts a Stop to Plans for Virtual Credit Cards
headline.print_headline: China Puts a Stop to Plans for Virtual Credit Cards
